Your Own Class

Using the Basketball code as an example you should be able to write and document your own class.

Your task is write a class named Atom in your lab2 package. The Atom class has three instance variables representing an atom's state: the number of protons, neutrons, and electrons. The constructor should look like this: 

public Atom(int givenProtons, int givenNeutrons, int givenElectrons) {
   // insert code to assign given values to instance variables 
}

Class Atom should also have the following methods:

  • int getAtomicMass() - returns total number of protons plus neutrons
  • int getAtomicCharge() - returns the difference between the number of protons and electrons
  • void decay() - decreases the number of protons by 2 and the number of neutrons by 2

Be sure to document your class, methods, and instance variables. The methods should be public and the instance variables should be private. Use the Basketball class as a model. When you have written the documentation, regenerate the HTML for your project and see what it looks like.
